results.title: Timor: island of fear, island of hope
results.creator_credit: Boubaker Adjala and Timor Defence Foundation
results.brief_description: An historical introduction to East Timor as well as a commentary on contemporary political and military conflicts. Includes film reports from four Australian journalists killed at Balibo in October 1975 and footage of Australian Labor MHR Ken Fry at the United Nations.

results.title: Times have changed
results.creator_credit: Lillian Murray, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Lillian Murray has worked in the offices of Legacy in Melbourne’s CBD for the last 29 years. It is her home away from home and she reflects on the technological changes there as well as the good times and the great people she has the pleasure to work with.

results.title: Times are changing
results.creator_credit: Mitch Matthews, Ben Cardillo and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: A contemporary Australian story which considers the effects of unemployment on family life. George loses his job after 35 years of employment and not knowing how to tell his wife and family, pretends to go to work each day. Ideal for considering the value of work and study, the importance attached to work as viewed by different generations, family relationships, traditional sex roles, technological change and communication. Lead role played by Max Cullen.

results.title: Timeless treasure
results.brief_description: Deals with the continual deterioration and destruction of man’s cultural heritage and the need for active preservation. Shows rebuilding and restoration work, and discusses the role of UNESCO’s International Study Centre for the Restoration and Preservation of Cultural Property in organising and assisting such undertakings as safe-guarding the temples threatened by the Aswan Dam in the Nubian Valley

results.title: Timeless Temiar
results.creator_credit: Zain Hussain and Malayan Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows the life of the Aborigines of the Temiar tribe of Northern Perak, Malaya. They lead a civilised life when left in their own environment and make full use of jungle resources.

results.title: Timeless stories = The Witch and the owl ...
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath and International Video Books
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
Dorothy Butler introduces this video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers and have been selected for children aged eight to eleven years old. The stories are: “The Musicians of Bremen”, “The Writing on the wall”, “Did you ever?”, “Chanticleer”, “Mr. and Mrs. Hay the horse”, “Mabel’s story”, “The Witch and the owl”, “Funnybones” and “Jorinda and Joringel”.
results.title_for_label: Timeless stories = The Witch and the owl …

results.title: Timecrimes
results.brief_description: A man accidentally gets into a time machine and travels back in time nearly an hour. Finding himself will be the first of a series of disasters of unforeseeable consequences.
results.description: A man accidentally gets into a time machine and travels back in time nearly an hour. Finding himself will be the first of a series of disasters of unforeseeable consequences.
description_for_label: A man accidentally gets into a time machine and travels back in time nearly an hour. Finding himself will be the first of a series of disasters of unforeseeable consequences.

results.title: Timecode
results.brief_description: An inventive film that follows four storylines unfolding simultaneously in each quarter of the screen, which are all composed of one shot.

constellations_other.name: Lois Weber and the split-screen
constellations_other.description: Lois Weber was the third filmmaker to use split screens to show simultaneous action, helping establish it as part of cinematic language, particularly its use in thrillers. It's since been taken to extremes by auteurs and videogames.

results.description: A production company begins casting for its next feature, and an up-and-coming actress named Rose tries to manipulate her filmmaker boyfriend, Alex, into giving her a screen test. Alex’s wife, Emma, knows about the affair and is considering divorce, while Rose’s girlfriend secretly spies on her and attempts to sabotage the relationship. The four storylines in the film were each shot in one take and are shown simultaneously, each taking up a quarter of the screen.
description_for_label: A production company begins casting for its next feature, and an up-and-coming actress named Rose tries to manipulate her filmmaker boyfriend, Alex, into giving her a screen test. results.title: Time: measurement and meaning
results.brief_description: How does time move, what is “now”, what is reverse, or “backward” time? This account of modern theoretical and practical physical science examines concepts of time dilation, the entropy principle and astronomical time, relation of subjective and external time and the definition of a second. Scientific timepieces are shown, such as an atomic clock and a waterclock, as well as a brief glimpse of a cyclotron.
